comments:
Various places in the BIRT code, exceptions are caught, a stack trace is printed, and the code continues.

Outputting standard error (e.printStackTrace flows the several pages of stack trace all the way back to the caller) makes it look like an error occurred, but the code continues anyway.

When the exception is caught, either it's and error (exception should be thrown) or it's not (write a trace message to the log and continue).  But e.printStrackTrace causes problems for callers.  As a caller, I can't tell if an error occurred or not.  Do I continue or not.

As an example, I create a design with a dynamic parameter, and mis-spell the host name (localhos).  Then I try and get the selection list.  BIRT catches an exception, prints the stacktrace, and continues as if there were no error.  In this example, catch that eats the excpetion is on line 489 of org\eclipse\birt\report\engine\api\impl\GetParameterDefinitionTask.java

There of dozens examples more throughout the code.

What the caller sees:

Engine has fixed it.
But also need DTE, MODEL and UI to fix it.
So please transfer this bug one by one to check it.

Dte has fixed it.
Now reassign it to UI team .

Log exception information in stead of printing.
GUI part is fixed.

Reassign it to Model team, if model team think they don't have this issue, please pass this bug to another team or set it to FIXED.
